name: Urban Life is a Dream
title: Minimal Urbanization
description: As of 2024, only 4.32% of Ethiopia's population lives in urban agglomerations with more than 1 million people, indicating a predominantly rural lifestyle.

name: Education's Big Investment
title: High Expenditure on Tertiary Education
description: In 2015, Ethiopia allocated 47.85% of its government education expenditure to tertiary education, showcasing a strong commitment to higher education.

name: Exporting Patience
title: Long Export Lead Time
description: In 2018, the median lead time to export goods from Ethiopia was 60 days, highlighting logistical challenges in international trade.

name: Sanitation Struggles
title: Limited Basic Sanitation Access
description: As of 2022, only 9.34% of Ethiopia's population had access to at least basic sanitation services, indicating significant public health challenges.

name: Birth Registration Blues
title: Incomplete Birth Registration
description: In 2016, only 2.7% of births in Ethiopia were registered, reflecting gaps in civil registration systems.

name: Eco-Friendly Energy
title: Minimal CO2 Emissions from Energy
description: In 2023, Ethiopia's CO2 emissions from fugitive energy sources were negligible at 0.0001 Mt CO2e, showcasing its low carbon footprint in energy production.

name: Few Female Scholars
title: Low Female Doctoral Attainment
description: In 2021, only 0.006% of Ethiopian women aged 25+ had attained a doctoral degree, indicating gender disparities in higher education.

name: Entrepreneurial Gap
title: Low Employer Representation
description: In 2023, only 0.13% of Ethiopia's total employment was made up of employers, suggesting limited entrepreneurial opportunities.
